definition: to open one's mouth (to speak, esp. to make a request)/to gape
to open up/to spread/sheet of paper/classifier for flat objects, sheet/classifier for votes

sentences.english: The Crow set up a loud caw and dropped the flesh.
sentences.chinese: 乌鸦张嘴大叫了一声，把肉掉了。

sentences.english: His mother had not returned yet and little penguin was staring with his mouse open .
sentences.chinese: 小企鹅的妈妈还没回来，他在张嘴而望。

sentences.english: Raj: Can you even open your mouth without spewing a cultural stereotype?
sentences.chinese: 你为什么每次一张嘴吐出来的全是文化成见呢？

sentences.english: Life was hard enough already without four extra mouths to feed.
sentences.chinese: 生活已经足够艰辛，要再多喂四张嘴也是勉为其难。

sentences.english: Know why people do only one mouth?
sentences.chinese: 知道为什么人只有一张嘴吗？

sentences.english: After opening his mouth once or twice more, Dudley subsided into scarlet-faced silence.
sentences.chinese: 达力又张了张嘴，最终还是涨红了脸没有说话。

sentences.english: You might accidentally open your mouth to yell and accidentally breathe in some water.
sentences.chinese: 你可能冷不丁地张嘴呼叫，吸进一些水。

sentences.english: First of all, they must manage their life, a mouth, loose lips, so much hurt.
sentences.chinese: 人生首先要管好自己的一张嘴，祸从口出，话多伤人。

sentences.english: The bitch - goddess , Success, was trailed by thousands of gasping, dogs with lolling tongues.
sentences.chinese: “成功”的财神后面，跟着成千的张嘴垂舌的狗儿。

sentences.english: The calf has two lower jaws, but only one mouth.
sentences.chinese: 这只“双面牛”有两只较短的下巴，但只有一张嘴。

sentences.english: Opened mouth wouldn't even monosyllabic name cleanly.
sentences.chinese: 张了张嘴连单音节也没法利落地说出。

sentences.english: "Wa-" The meat fell down to the ground as soon as he opened its mouth.
sentences.chinese: 没想到，它刚一张嘴，肉就掉了下来。

sentences.english: Each mouth is filled with rows of flaming teeth.
sentences.chinese: 每张嘴都排满了燃烧的牙齿。

sentences.english: I saw a horse eating with two mouths , one on each side of his head!
sentences.chinese: 我梦见一匹马用脑侧各一的两张嘴进食。

sentences.english: Be seated somewhere; and until you can speak pleasantly, remain silent.
sentences.chinese: 找个地方去坐着，不会和气说话就别张嘴。

sentences.english: "I wish Melly would keep her mouth shut, " cried Scarlett.
sentences.chinese: “我但愿媚兰闭住她那张嘴才好，”思嘉大声喊道。

definition: to open one's mouth (to eat, speak etc)/to gape/to start talking (esp. to make a request)
mouth/CL:張|张[zhang1]/slap in the face/CL:個|个[ge4]
to open one's mouth/to start to talk
Shut up!/same as 閉上嘴巴|闭上嘴巴
big mouthful (of food, drink, smoke etc)/open mouth/gulping/gobbling/gaping
tongue/CL:個|个[ge4]/enemy soldier captured for the purpose of extracting information
to open one's eyes wide/to stare/to glare (at sb)/to scowl
